info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 2:33PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Chester and southeastern Union Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 233 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Union, or near Carlisle, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carlisle, Leeds and Santuc. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
